description: Smallest number that is palindromic (with at least 2 digits) in n bases.
comments: Smallest number k that is palindromic in n bases, 1<n<k.Only a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4) & a(7) are not congruent to 0 (mod 12). - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 21 2014
links: Giovanni Resta and Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..342 (first 100 terms from Giovanni Resta).
Robert G. Wilson v, Smallest number which is palindromic in n bases or 0 if no such number is known
example: 10 is a palindrome in base 3, 4 and 9: 101(3), 22(4) and 11(9). So a(3)=10.
mathematica: f[n_] := Module[{idn, s = Floor@ Sqrt[n + 1] - 1}, lng = Table[ If[ Reverse[ idn = IntegerDigits[n, b]] == idn, {b}, Sequence @@ {}], {b, 2, s + 1}]; If[ IntegerQ@ Sqrt[n + 1], -1, 0] + Length@ lng + Count[ Mod[n, Range@ s], 0]]; f[n_] := 0 /; n < 3; t = Table[0, {700}]; k = 3; While[k <1100000001, a = f[k]; If[ t[[a]] == 0, t[[a]] = k; Print[{a, k}]]; k++]; Take[t, 310] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 02 2014 *)
